tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE sales_notifications (
  lead_id INT,
  lead_name VARCHAR,
  lead_email VARCHAR,
  follow_up_date TIMESTAMP,
  deal_status VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE sales_leads (
    lead_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    lead_name VARCHAR(50),
    lead_email VARCHAR(100),
    lead_source VARCHAR(50),
    created_at TIMESTAMP,
    last_updated TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE follow_ups (
    follow_up_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    lead_id UUID REFERENCES sales_leads(lead_id),
    follow_up_date DATE,
    follow_up_type VARCHAR(50),
    follow_up_notes TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP,
    last_updated TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE deals_closing (
    deal_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    lead_id UUID REFERENCES sales_leads(lead_id),
    deal_amount DECIMAL(10,2),
    deal_status VARCHAR(50),
    closing_date DATE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP,
    last_updated TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE email_notifications (
    notification_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    notification_message TEXT,
    recipient_email VARCHAR(100),
    sent_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE SalesLeads (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 email VARCHAR(255),
 name VARCHAR(255),
 company VARCHAR(255),
 status VARCHAR(50),
 created_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE FollowUps (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 lead_id INT,
 follow_up_date TIMESTAMP,
 notes TEXT,
 completed BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE DealsClosingStages (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 lead_id INT,
 closing_date TIMESTAMP,
 amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
 closed BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE Notifications (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 lead_id INT,
 notification_date TIMESTAMP,
 message TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE Users (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 email VARCHAR(255),
 name VARCHAR(255),
 role VARCHAR(50)
)
